labels.analysis: The MCP Server is designed to interact with Figma files, allowing users to add, view, and comment on designs through an AI assistant. This enhances collaboration and feedback processes by enabling direct engagement with Figma content without needing to navigate the Figma interface separately. The available tools support file management, node visualization, comment reading, and real-time interaction with design feedback.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Design & Collaboration" was chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around managing and interacting with design files and facilitating feedback processes. Secondary labels like "File Management" and "Communication Tools" were added because the server includes operations for managing Figma files and communicating through comments and replies.

server_info_crawled.author: @MatthewDailey/figma-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Interact with Figma files seamlessly. Add, view, and comment on designs directly through your AI assistant, enhancing collaboration and feedback processes.

tools.description: Get a thumbnail for a specific node in a Figma file

tools.name: reply_to_comment

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@MatthewDailey/figma-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: figmaApiKey
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: Figma API key with File content and Comments scopes
